post.summary: Add a new pet to the store.
post.description: Add a new pet to the store.

put.summary: Update an existing pet(‚≠êÔ∏èUpdate at June 13.v8).
put.description: Update an existing pet by Id.

post.summary: Updates a pet in the store with form data.
post.description: Updates a pet resource based on the form data.

parameters.name: petId
parameters.description: ID of pet that needs to be updated

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of pet that needs to be updated

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of pet that needs to be updated

get.description: Multiple status values can be provided with comma separated strings.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

get.description: Multiple tags can be provided with comma separated strings. Use tag1, tag2, tag3 for testing.

post.summary: Place an order for a pet.
post.description: Place a new order in the store.

delete.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value < 1000. Anything above 1000 or non-integers will generate API errors.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the order that needs to be deleted

get.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value <= 5 or > 10. Other values will generate exceptions.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of order that needs to be fetched

get.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities.

get.summary: Logs out current logged in user session.
get.description: Log user out of the system.

post.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

post.summary: Creates list of users with given input array.
post.description: Creates list of users with given input array.

put.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: name that need to be deleted

delete.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name that needs to be deleted

get.description: Get user detail based on username.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name that needs to be fetched. Use user1 for testing

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password for login in clear text

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

X-Expires-After.description: date in UTC when token expires

post.summary: Creates list of users with given input array

Carbon-Unit.title: Carbon Unit
Carbon-Unit.description: SQUAKE uses The International System of Units (SI), commonly referred to as "metric system".

SQUAKE-Request-Id.name: SQUAKE-Request-Id
SQUAKE-Request-Id.description: Unique identifier linked to this API request. If you need to contact us regarding a specific request, providing the request identifier helps the resolution process.

audit.title: Distance-Unit
audit.description: SQUAKE provides you the option to create audit records for your calculations requests. **Note:** to use this feature you need to have it enabled for your account, please contact us for more information.

source.description: An object containing references to the primary source of the error

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like title, this field's value can be localized.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

booking_class.description: If you don't pass a `booking_class` then `fare_class` and `airline` are required. SQUAKE will then automatically resolve the correct `booking_class`; used for `DEFRA`, `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL`, `TIM`, `GATE4` and `ICAO`. For `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL` this is optional with `average` as the default value. For `DEFRA` `average` is the default, while `economy` is the default for `TIM`, `ICAO` and `GATE4`.

aircraft_size.description: An estimation of the aircraft's size based on the number of seats; used for `ADEME` and `BASE-EMPREINTE`.

Train.title: Train
Train.description: The full list of operators supported by SQUAKE could be found [here](https://squake.notion.site/21a17389cc5c4e38946f97ecaf6435bb?v=6be41159e77247599fe9b3672782fd5e). If your operator is not supported, feel free to contact us.

train_type.description: ADEME defaults to `local_express` and only considers `high_speed`, `mainline`, and `local_express`. SQUAKE's methodology defaults to `regional` without and `high_speed` with an `operator_name` given. CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL considers `average` and `international`, defaults to `average`, DEFRA considers `national`, `international`, `light`, `tram` and `underground`, defaults to `national`

fuel_type.description: `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL` considers `diesel`, `electricity` and `average`, defaults to `average`. `ADEME` considers `diesel` and `electricity`, defaults to `diesel`. `SQUAKE` considers `diesel`, `electricity`, `hydrogen`, and `hybrid`; defaults to `diesel`. If `operator_name` is passed, then `fuel_type` is ignored.

operator_name.description: `SQUAKE`'s methodology allows passing the operator's name to get a more accurate result. `train_type` defaults to `high_speed` if `operator_name` is passed. Here is [the database](https://squake.notion.site/21a17389cc5c4e38946f97ecaf6435bb?v=6be41159e77247599fe9b3672782fd5e) with the supported operators.

booking_class.description: If you don't pass a `booking_class` then `fare_class` and `airline` are required. SQUAKE will then automatically resolve the correct `booking_class`; used for `DEFRA`, `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL`, `TIM`, `GATE4` and `ICAO`. For `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL` this is optional with `average` as the default value. For `DEFRA` `average` is the default, while `economy` is the default for `TIM`, `ICAO` and `GATE4`.

aircraft_size.description: An estimation of the aircraft's size based on the number of seats; used for `ADEME` and `BASE-EMPREINTE`.

fare_class.description: The combination of `fare_class` and `airline` is mutually exclusive with `booking_class`. This is a single letter e.g. `Y`, `J`, etc.

airline.description: The IATA Designator of an airline, e.g., 2-digit format like `LH` or 3-digit format like `220`. Airline names and ICAO codes are also supported, SQUAKE will then automatically resolve it. The combination of `fare_class` and `airline` is mutually exclusive with `booking_class`.

flight_number.description: Flight numbers should include the airline designator, for example `BA115` is accepted but `115` also works with passed separately `airline`; used for `TIM` and `GATE4`.

radiative_forcing_index.description: Controls if a multiplier that factors in gases emitted to the atmosphere when flying at altitude should be applied; used for `BASE-EMPREINTE`, `DEFRA` and `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL`.

booking_class.description: If you don't pass a `booking_class` then `fare_class` and `airline` are required. SQUAKE will then automatically resolve the correct `booking_class`; used for `DEFRA`, `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL`, `TIM`, `GATE4` and `ICAO`. For `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL` this is optional with `average` as the default value. For `DEFRA` `average` is the default, while `economy` is the default for `TIM`, `ICAO` and `GATE4`.

allOf.title: DefraTrain
allOf.description: The full list of operators supported by SQUAKE could be found [here](https://squake.notion.site/21a17389cc5c4e38946f97ecaf6435bb?v=6be41159e77247599fe9b3672782fd5e). If your operator is not supported, feel free to contact us.

train_type.description: ADEME defaults to `local_express` and only considers `high_speed`, `mainline`, and `local_express`. SQUAKE's methodology defaults to `regional` without and `high_speed` with an `operator_name` given. CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL considers `average` and `international`, defaults to `average`, DEFRA considers `national`, `international`, `light`, `tram` and `underground`, defaults to `national`

fuel_type.description: `CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL` considers `diesel`, `electricity` and `average`, defaults to `average`. `ADEME` considers `diesel` and `electricity`, defaults to `diesel`. `SQUAKE` considers `diesel`, `electricity`, `hydrogen`, and `hybrid`; defaults to `diesel`. If `operator_name` is passed, then `fuel_type` is ignored.

operator_name.description: `SQUAKE`'s methodology allows passing the operator's name to get a more accurate result. `train_type` defaults to `high_speed` if `operator_name` is passed. Here is [the database](https://squake.notion.site/21a17389cc5c4e38946f97ecaf6435bb?v=6be41159e77247599fe9b3672782fd5e) with the supported operators.

SQUAKE's methodology defaults to `regional` without and `high_speed` with an `operator_name` given. CO2-EMISSIEFACTOREN-NL considers `average` and `international`, defaults to `average`, DEFRA considers `national`, `international`, `light`, `tram` and `underground`, defaults to `national`

If `operator_name` is passed, then `fuel_type` is ignored.
